body:
### Describe the bug

This is what I was trying to do.  It worked in the past, but when I changed the name of the directory Version_1.5, it doesn't work anymore.  I don't get it.

```
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19045.2846]
(c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

C:\Windows\system32>H:

H:\>cd %AWS_PC_BACKUP_SOURCECODE_DIRECTORY%\src\c

H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>..\..\act_3112.bat

H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>"H:/Users/LindaJim/Documents/SourceCode/Software/aws_pc_backup/Version_1.5/prod3112/Scripts/activate.bat"

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>python --version
Python 3.11.2

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>pip list
Package            Version
------------------ ---------
attrs              22.2.0
boto3              1.26.99
botocore           1.29.99

charset-normalizer 3.1.0

Cython             3.0.0b2
idna               3.4

psutil             5.9.4

python-dateutil    2.8.2
requests           2.28.2
s3transfer         0.6.0
setuptools         65.5.0
six                1.16.0
urllib3            1.26.15

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>cython -3 --embed -o delete_old_log_files.c ..\..\src\python\delete_old_log_files.py

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
import os
^
------------------------------------------------------------

H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\python\delete_old_log_files.py:1:0: 'aws_pc_backup.Version_1.5.src.python.delete_old_log_files' is not a valid module name

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>pip uninstall Cython
Found existing installation: Cython 3.0.0b2
Uninstalling Cython-3.0.0b2:
  Would remove:
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\lib\site-packages\cython-3.0.0b2.dist-info\*
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\lib\site-packages\cython.py
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\lib\site-packages\cython\*
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\lib\site-packages\pyximport\*
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\scripts\cygdb.exe
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\scripts\cython.exe
    h:\users\lindajim\documents\sourcecode\software\aws_pc_backup\version_1.5\prod3112\scripts\cythonize.exe
Proceed (Y/n)? Y
  Successfully uninstalled Cython-3.0.0b2

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>pip install Cython
Collecting Cython
  Using cached Cython-0.29.34-py2.py3-none-any.whl (988 kB)
Installing collected packages: Cython
Successfully installed Cython-0.29.34

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>cython -3 --embed -o delete_old_log_files.c ..\..\src\python\delete_old_log_files.py

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
import os
^
------------------------------------------------------------

H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\python\delete_old_log_files.py:1:0: 'aws_pc_backup.Version_1.5.src.python.delete_old_log_files' is not a valid module name

(prod3112) H:\Users\LindaJim\Documents\SourceCode\Software\aws_pc_backup\Version_1.5\src\c>
```

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# example code
```
See above.

### Expected behaviour

It should compile without any errors.  I don't know why it is having issues now.

### OS

Windows 10

### Python version

3.11.2

### Cython version

3.0.0b2 and 0.29.34

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body: If I change the directory name to Version_1_5, it works just fine.

Do you have any files called "__init__.py" in the directories above the file that you are trying to compile?

I wonder why it's picking up the whole directory path here. Maybe because you are running Cython from the target directory instead of the source (or project) directory?

In any case, your problem has nothing to do with the os module or its import. It's complaining about the module name here, or what it considers the fully qualified module name including packages.
Yep.  that was the cause.  I had __init__.py in a couple of directories above where I was running the cython command.  I deleted them and it ran fine.  Not sure why they were there.  Thanks.

title: [BUG] can't handle import os after changing directory structure
